agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Redistricting TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Thursday, April 4, 2019 PLACE: JHR 140 CHAIR: Rep. Phil King *Testimony may be limited to 3 minutes* HB 104 Johnson, Eric Relating to the inclusion of an incarcerated person in the population data used for redistricting according to the person's last residence before incarceration. HB 312 Howard | et al. Relating to the reapportionment of state legislative, congressional, and judicial districts and the creation, function, and duties of the Texas Redistricting Commission. HB 3421 González, Mary Relating to the Independent Citizen Redistricting Commission. HB 3928 Neave Relating to the Texas Redistricting Commission. HB 4564 Davis, Yvonne Relating to establishing principles to govern redistricting plans enacted by the legislature. HJR 25 Howard Proposing a constitutional amendment establishing the Texas Redistricting Commission to redistrict the Texas Legislature and Texas congressional districts and revising procedures for redistricting. HJR 59 Anchia Proposing a constitutional amendment establishing the Texas Redistricting Commission to redistrict the Texas Legislature and Texas congressional districts and revising procedures for redistricting. HJR 123 Neave Proposing a constitutional amendment establishing the Texas Redistricting Commission to redistrict the Texas Legislature, Texas congressional districts, and State Board of Education districts and revising procedures for redistricting. HJR 140 Reynolds Proposing a constitutional amendment providing for the reapportionment of congressional districts and the creation, function, and duties of the Texas Congressional Redistricting Commission. *Testimony may be limited to 3 minutes* Bills added after last posting: HJR 59 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
